Description: Fragment of a green jasper scarab of classical Phoenician type, engraved on the underside with a long-beard right profile portrait of Herakles, wearing his trademark Nemean lion skin head dress, ending in two volutes at the bottom. The head is framed by a braided pattern along the border. The right part of the scarab (left part of the intaglio) was missing and has been reconstructed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North of the site
Curator's comments: Scarab "green paste, imitating jasper, (...) of the regular style of fine Phoenician work", coming "from the north of Defenneh", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xli, 42
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (321)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xli, 42)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.66, p.181, pl.23)
